p: Teicoplanin belonging to the class of glycopeptide antibiotic is used for the treatment of gram-positive bacterial infections. The previous report suggested that teicoplanin and its derivatives were capable of blocking the viral entry of the Ebola virus, SARS-CoV, and MERS-CoV into the cell by blocking cathepsin L [46]. A recent report by the same research group suggests that teicoplanin potently inhibits the entry of SARS-CoV-2-S-pseudoviruses by blocking cathepsin L. (IC 50 = 1.66 µM) [47]. Given its antibacterial prowess, teicoplanin could be considered as a dual inhibitor of the SARS-CoV-2 and its associated bacterial co-infections. However, further evidence is required to support such a claim.
